sim.long-description: The Antonov An-24 is a successful Soviet aircraft designed in 1957. Its many variants still serve as cargo, transport, reconnaissance, fire fighter, or even as navigator training plane. Its derivatives, the An-26, An-30 and An-32 are used for military purposes.
sim.author: Michael Soitanen (FDM, Systems), Adrian (3D, Systems)

help.title: An-24B

key.name: Ctrl+L
key.desc: Cycle nose wheel steering OFF, TAKEOFF/LANDING, TAXI

help.text:
For a quick start guide, please read section 1 of the QuickStartUpGuide.pdf Vref for 19 t and more: 210 km/h (flaps 38) Vref for less than 19 t: 200 km/h (flaps 38)
NOTE: 1-4 keys can be remapped to their standard bindings as stated in Common Aircraft Keys for keyboad flying, see keyboard mode in aircraft Preferences. In keyboard mode views are accesible only by Alt- bindings.
